		Question: what is the government system of malaysia
		Answer:
answer:
The answer is: 

Malaysia is a federation of 13 states and two federal territories. The Constitution of Malaysia adopts a Westminster-style parliamentary system. The head of state is the King of Malaysia, who is also the ceremonial head of the federation. The King appoints the Prime Minister, who leads the federal government. The Prime Minister is chosen by the King after a meeting of the Council of State and is appointed in the name of the King by the Yang di-Pertuan Agong,
